channel.title: Rune evo v3 help LAN
channel.description: ok so... I have the Local ip in my client and it loads and works fine for me... i sent the client with the Local ip in to my friend, we are using same network. but they can't connect... what else do I need to do?????

item.title: Rune evo v3 help LAN
item.dc:creator: @TimeRS3 TimeRS3
item.description:
@TimeRS3 wrote:

don’t use hamachi throw that idea out.

You can’t have other players connect to server using local IP.

If your selfhosting go to http://www.whatsmyip.org then replace your local IP with the IP it shows you on whatsmyip.org

send that client to your friend it should work fine if you have portforwarded and everything just fine.

If you have any more problems I suggest you take a look at shabba56’s tutorial for 667+ It’s perfect for beginners and it will show you how to jar the client as well if you don’t want to send the entire client folder to your friend.

Read full topic

item.title: Rune evo v3 help LAN
item.dc:creator: @grandstinger grandstinger
item.description:
@grandstinger wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:4, topic:541735”][quote author=grandstinger link=topic=660603.msg4416759#msg4416759 date=1396279575]

You need to give them the IPv4 Address. If go to cmd and type ipconfig the IPv4 address should be there.
[/quote] i put in the ip4 address in the client and it still gets stuck at 0% for them.

Maybe you need to port forward.[/quote] do you know if it is possible to use Hamachi? and if so, how? what would I need to do/change?

Read full topic

item.title: Rune evo v3 help LAN

You need to give them the IPv4 Address. If go to cmd and type ipconfig the IPv4 address should be there.
